5. Councilmember Tracy Furutani

# Councilmember Tracy Furutani Profile

## Profile

### Deputy Mayor

Position 5

Term:  January 2022 - December 2025

Tracy Furutani was born and raised in Los Angeles, and has been a resident of Lake Forest Park since 2004, after stops in the Bay Area and Seattle.

![Councilmember Tracy Furutani 2022](https://www.cityoflfp.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentID=10190 "Councilmember Tracy Furutani 2022")

## City and Regional Representation

Council Liaison, Lake Forest Park Climate Action Committee

Member, Lake Ballinger/McAleer Watershed Creek Forum

Member, Water Resource Inventory Area 8 Salmon Recovery Council (WRIA 8)

Member, K4C Outreach Committee

Alternate, King County Solid Waste Advisory Committee (SWAC)

## Education and Professional Experience

Tracy Furutani graduated from the California Institute of Technology with a Bachelor of Science in chemistry and history. Tracy then earned a Master of Science in chemistry from Stanford University and a PhD in geological sciences from the University of Washington. Since 1996, he has been a full-time faculty member at North Seattle College (formerly North Seattle Community College), teaching earth sciences, environmental sciences, chemistry, physics, anthropology and biochemistry.

## Contact

Citizens can reach Deputy Mayor Furutani by phone at 206-368-5440, Ext. 252 or [email Deputy Mayor Furutani](mailto:tfurutani@cityoflfp.gov).
